text.text_translated: Asteroids are rocks that fly through space. Some of them are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids'. These rocks can pass close to Earth's path around the sun. They can come within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth. NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these asteroids. None of them are a danger for the next 100 years. With the technology we have now, NASA can follow these objects. They can also predict a possible hit. If this happens, we could use two different solutions to protect Earth.
